profileText: (Great-great-nephew of Alexander Hamilton Stephens), a Representative from Georgia; born in Atlanta, Fulton County, Ga., August 14, 1913; graduated from Boys High School, Atlanta, Ga., 1931; A.B., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1935; M.A., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1937; LL.B., University of Georgia Law School, Athens, Ga., 1941; attended the University of Hamburg, Germany, 1935-1936; United States Army, 1941-1946; faculty, University of Georgia, Athens, Ga.; legal staff of Mr. Justice Jackson at the Nuremberg trials of major Nazi war criminals; lawyer, private practice; city attorney of Athens, Ga., 1947-1950; member of the Georgia state senate, 1951-1953; member of the Georgia state house of representatives, 1953-1959; delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1964; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1961-January 3, 1977); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fifth Congress in 1976; died on February 20, 2003, in Athens, Ga.; interment in Oconee Hill Cemetery, Athens, Clarke County, Ga.

researchRecord.description: This collection consists of the congressional papers of Robert G. Stephens, Jr. from 1957-1976. The papers include correspondence, press releases, scrapbooks, photographs, voting records, and notes reflecting Robert Stephens's activities in Congress (1961-1976). The collection contains legislative and committee files relating to his work on the House Banking and Currency Committee (1961-1976), the House Interior and Insular Affairs Committee (1971-1976), and the Select Committee on Committees (1973-1974). Other series relate to federally funded projects in the State of Georgia such as housing, airports, health facilities, and water quality management including watersheds. The collection also contains records documenting Robert Stephens's political campaigns. A finding aid for the papers is available in the repository.
